routes.title: Understanding JavaScript abstract equality
routes.description: It's common knowledge to use the strict equality operator === over the abstract equality operator ==. I'm not going to dive into why you should prefer === because there are plenty of explanations on that topic already.

routes.title: Javascript's this keyword: Two simple rules that might end the confusion
routes.description: Yesterday, I was implementing a **throttle** function and ran into a `this` bug that took me 20 minutes to debug before deciding to use AI to fix it. I needed to throttle button clicks while preserving the button's context:

routes.title: Autocomplete, debouncing, and caching
routes.description: I recently read about designing an autocomplete implementation in greatfrontend.com. While it appears as a simple component visually, it has a surprisingly complex implementation underneath.

routes.title: Feed, offset-based pagination, virtualization
routes.description: In this experiment, we compare two feed implementations to measure the performance impact of DOM virtualization on infinite scroll feeds. Both implementations use offset-based pagination but differ in how they handle DOM rendering as the feed grows.
